body:

title: How I Built This Blog
excerpt: A look at the tech choices and design decisions behind Tianbook â a lightweight, no-framework personal blog.
body:
I wanted my blog to be fast, simple, and easy to maintain. No heavy frameworks, no build steps â just clean HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Design Principles

  • Minimalism â Content comes first. No clutter.
  • Performance â Zero dependencies means instant loads.
  • Simplicity â Easy to understand, easy to modify.

The Stack

The entire site is built with vanilla HTML, CSS, and JS. Blog posts are stored as JSON data, which keeps things straightforward while still allowing dynamic rendering.

The best tool is the simplest one that gets the job done.

What's Next

I plan to add more posts regularly and possibly introduce features like dark mode and a search function in the future. For now, I'm happy with this clean foundation.
